content.title: Mukhyamantri Teerth Darshan Yojana
content.department: Department of Religious Trusts and Endowments, Government of Madhya Pradesh
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhyamantri Teerth Darshan Yojana' was launched by the Department of Religious Trusts and Endowments, Government of Madhya Pradesh in June 2012. Under the scheme, the state government provides one-time assistance to senior citizens above 60 years of age (2 years relaxation in case of women) of the state to visit a prescribed pilgrimage outside the state. In this scheme, free travel is made to senior citizens of the state to the identified pilgrimage site in the country. The pilgrims travel by special train, breakfast, food, and pure drinking water, arrangements for stay at pilgrimage places, travel by bus where necessary, and other facilities are made available by Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited (IRCTC) contracted with Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh.
benefits: The State Government provides one-time assistance in a lifetime to senior citizens above 60 years of age (2 years relaxation in case of women) to visit a prescribed pilgrimage outside the state.
In this scheme, senior citizens of the state are made to travel to the identified pilgrimage sites of the country free of cost.

The pilgrims travel by special train, breakfast, food, and pure drinking water, arrangements for stay at pilgrimage places, travel by bus where necessary, and other facilities are made available by Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited (IRCTC) contracted with Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh.
eligibility: The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh.
The age of the male applicant should be 60 years or above.
The age of the female applicant should be 58 years or above.
There is no age limit for disabled citizens whose disability is more than 60%.
If the husband and wife want to travel together, then if one of the spouses is eligible, the life partner can also go on the journey, even if his age is less than 60 years.
The applicant should not be a taxpayer.
The applicant should not have taken the benefit of Teerth Darshan Yojna earlier.

The applicant should be physically and mentally fit for the journey and should not be suffering from any infectious disease like TB, congestive cardiac, obstructive respiratory disease, coronary insufficiency, coronary thrombosis, mental illness, infectious leprosy, etc.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar card, Voter ID Card
For residence proof (Ration card, Driving license, electricity bill, or any other evidence recognized by the State Government)
A medical certificate i.e. physically and mentally fit and not suffering from any infectious disease

faqs.question: What is 'Mukhyamantri Teerth Darshan Yojana' scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the state government provides one-time assistance to senior citizens above 60 years of age (2 years relaxation in case of women) of the state to visit a prescribed pilgrimage outside the state.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: This scheme was launched in June 2012.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The senior citizen above 60 years of age who belongs to Madhya Pradesh subject to all other conditions is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: In this scheme, free travel is made to senior citizens of the state to the identified pilgrimage site in the country.

faqs.question: What are the pilgrimages under the scheme?
faqs.answer: At present, the State Government has selected Shri Badrinath, Shri Kedarnath, Shri Jagannath Puri, Shri Dwarka Ji, Haridwar, Amarnath, Vaishno Devi, Shirdi, Tirupati, Ajmer Sharif, Kashi, Amritsar, Rameshwaram, Sammed Shikhar, Shravan Belgola and Belangi Church, Nagapattinam as pilgrimages under the scheme.

faqs.question: What other facilities will be provided during the journey under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The pilgrims travel by special train, breakfast, food, and pure drinking water, arrangements for stay at pilgrimage places, travel by bus where necessary, and other facilities are made available by Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited (IRCTC) contracted with Religious Trusts and Endowments Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for a male applicant to take the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The age of the male applicant should be 60 years or above.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for a female applicant to take the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The age of the female applicant should be 58 years or above.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for disabled citizens to take the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no age limit for disabled citizens whose disability is more than 60%.

faqs.question: How many times can the applicant avail of the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only once, the applicant can avail of the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for the applicant to provide a medical certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is mandatory for the applicant to provide a medical certificate that he is physically and mentally fit and not suffering from any infectious disease.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A senior citizen desirous to avail the benefit of the scheme should fill up an application in the prescribed proforma in two copies and submit the same at the nearest tahsil or sub-tahsil before the prescribed time limit. Photo and address proof should be affixed to the application.
